channel.title: How do i make client playable?
channel.description:
hello people, I am having a little problem with my client. I made a webclient using rs-ps.org and everything is messed up in there. So I think that the client will fix the problems.
Now when people login from the client, it just says error connecting to server, please reload client and try again. I change the GUI.java thing to my serverip and then this happens. When i change it to 127.0.0.1, it works.
Can anybody tell me how to fix this? thanks
I am using PkPlanet, 317

item.title: How do i make client playable?
item.dc:creator: @Da_Vinci Da Vinci
item.description:
@Da_Vinci wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:7, topic:352976”][quote author=farcastdreams link=topic=449290.msg3296435#msg3296435 date=1280975357]
You need to get your own private client without using the webclient and allow others to play. Or get 2 webclient: One for you and one for the other people.
[/quote]If i use the webclient, everything is fugged up. the heads are bobby, the names are like “afdfdsghkskdh017”
And I don’t get the first part, private client?[/quote]

Okay. Easy peasy.

Copy your client so you have two folders.
Name one of them: “_____ Client” #1
and the other “Usmans _______ Client” #2
In #1 add your No-IP to gui.java and in #2 add 127.0.0.1
Upload #1 for people to download, and keep #2 for yourself.

Hope I helped!
~Leo.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make client playable?

item.title: How do i make client playable?
item.dc:creator: @aznboi594 aznboi594
item.description:
@aznboi594 wrote:

When you download the server you get a client with it usually. You need to get that client as yours. If the heads are messed up when you login with the webclient then the webclient probably doesn’t go with your server.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i make client playable?
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“farcastdreams, post:4, topic:352976”]I don’t think you understand how to use gui.java.

  1. 127.0.0.1 is for your only
  2. The no-ip is for anyone else who is connecting.[/quote]Yeah, but when I make it 127.0.0.1 nobody can connect BUT me. And when i do no-ip, then I can’t connect.
    Any idea to make it for us both to connect?

Read full topic
